result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Jillian R. Leighton in court.  Attorney laurence M moon in court for Jillian R. Leighton.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Moon, State is objecting unless PTS condition is ordered. Bond amended. Additional discovery needs to be obtained. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice To Person Posting Bond Money

Defendant Jillian R. Leighton appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by DDA Sempf  Attorney laurence M moon in court for Jillian R. Leighton. Called @ 1:57 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for arraignment and motion to modify bond. Court addresses motion first.
Record by Atty. Moon. Objection by the State and further record by DDA Sempf. Court addresses Atty. Moon as to any changes in circumstances that would warrant reduction of bond. Response further argument by Atty. Moon. Based upon the record, Court denies the motion to modify bond.
Record by Atty. Moon as to arraignment and enters not guilty plea and requests trial dates. Discussion as to discovery and status rather than trial dates at this time. No objection by Atty. Moon. Matter set for status hearing.
Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 

State is requesting an Arraignment date.

Motion to modify Bond - Argument by Attorney Moon.
ADA Berg Objects to amending bond for reasons stated on the record.
Court denied amending bond at this time.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jillian R. Leighton in court, in custody by video. Attorney Haggerman for defendant, for bond purposes only. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Motion to modify bond by defense. Argument, denied. Bond remains. Bond set over the weekend. State objects to bond modification. SPD will need to re-assign outside office due to conflict.

Original Warrant filed with the court.
Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 9/15/2022: Comply with PRETRIAL SERVICES. DEFENDANT MAY POSSESS ALCOHOL FOR EMPLOYMENT PURPOSES ONLY.*

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH ANY CO-CONSPIRATORS NAMED IN THE COMPLAINT, OR RESIDENCES. NO CONTACT WITH ANY WITNESSES NAMED IN THE COMPLAINT, INCLUDING CONFIDENTIAL INFORMANTS, OR RESIDENCES. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jillian R. Leighton not in court. Attorney Obi Uzowulu appeared. Warrant remains. Minutes filed.
